org.patrodyne.etl.transformio
Class Transformer

java.lang.Object
  org.patrodyne.etl.transformio.Transformer
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommandLI, GraphicalUI, TextualUI
public abstract class Transformer
extends Object

An abstract class for core transformation methods.

This is the transformation engine used by all user interface modes. It contains methods for Java Scripting for transformations, unmarshalling/marshalling/executing Batch objects, opening/saving files, field pattern matching, notifications and extending the class path.

Author:
Rick O'Sullivan

getBatchUnmarshaller

protected static Unmarshaller getBatchUnmarshaller()
                                            throws JAXBException,
                                                   SAXException

On initial use, creates a Batch unmarshaller.

Creates an unmarshaller from a JAXBContext for the Batch class the sets the event handler to handle each ValidationEvent. Events emit notification(MessageType, String) messages.

Returns:
An unmarshaller to convert an XML representation into a Batch instance.
Throws:
JAXBException - when the unmarshaller cannot be created.
SAXException - when the XML Schema cannot be accessed or found.

The target to load.
Throws:
IOException - from #transform(Batch, Reader, Writer)
ScriptException - from #transform(Batch, Reader, Writer)

transform

public void transform(Batch batch,
                      Reader reader,
                      Writer writer,
                      boolean debug)
               throws IOException,
                      ScriptException

Transform a source Reader into a target Writer for the given Batch.

A transformation script is optional. When a script is defined, a script engine is created or retrieved for the given engine name (i.e. JavaScript) and bindings are created at the ScriptContext.ENGINE_SCOPE level. If the ScriptEngine is Compilable then a CompiledScript is produced.

The source is read and matched using the get patterns of its Record.Field specifications. For each match, the set pattern is checked for literal(String) substitutions before parsing the source field into its set format. The result is the field value prior to the transform script or target processing.

When there is a transform script, the source fields are bound to a script variable named source and the empty target fields are bound to a script variable named target. In the script, the source and target variables are maps where the key is the field name and the value is the field value. The script is evaluated. If the result is a Map then it is expected to be the target fields; otherwise, the result is retrieved from the bindings for the variable named target.

In other words, the script has access to two maps: source and target. The script populates the target map and, if the language allows, it should return the target map. If the language does not support returning the a map then the results are retrieved from the bindings for the variable named target.

Parameters:
batch - The batch configuration.
reader - To extract the source.
writer - To load the target.
debug - When true, increases the level for log messages.
Throws:
IOException - when the source cannot be read or the target cannot be written.
ScriptException - when the transform script cannot be compiled or evaluated.

execute

public void execute(Batch batch,
                    boolean debug)

Execute the extract, transform and load for the given batch.

The batch is validated, a Reader is created for the source and a Writer is created for the target then the transform is invoked.

Parameters:
batch - The batch configuration.
debug - When true, increases the level for log messages.
See Also:
transform(Batch, Reader, Writer, boolean)

logScriptEngines

protected void logScriptEngines()

Log list of supported languages.

If the INFO level is enabled for the logger then the script engine manager is used to get a list of script engine factories. For each factory, the list of short names is logged.
